summary:
Young professional ready to kickstart her career and put a stamp on the world! My name is Carmen and after graduating from Zuyd University of Applied Sciences in 2019, I am looking for a job that fits my many interests.

I grew up with a passion for languages and other cultures and when the moment was there to choose a field of study, I decided to start a bachelor's degree in Oriental Languages and Communication Japanese at Zuyd University of Applied Sciences in Maastricht, the Netherlands. After successfully completing a study abroad program at Kyoto University of Foreign Studies in Japan as well as a minor program in professional writing, I received my degree in 2019.

In December of the same year, I started working for PostNL in Eindhoven as a mail sorter. A few months later, I got to take the role of mentor upon myself as well. In this position, I train new employees and act as a guide for these employees as well as employees with mental disabilities.

Ideally, I would like to combine a few of my interests in my next career. I enjoy teaching, writing and helping others and would love to spend my working days doing these exact things. I am open to moving abroad, preferably Japan or an English-speaking country.

Please do not hesitate to get in contact with me if you are looking for a friendly, passionate and reliable employee for your organisation!

profile_positions.description:
Supervises a team of 8+ employees and oversees the correct handling of incoming and outgoing mail.
Manages faulty mail by thoroughly following fixed procedures to either deliver mail to the receiver or return it to the sender.
Guides employees with complex mental disabilities such as autism spectrum disorders, post-traumatic stress disorder and obsessive-compulsive personality disorder through their working day by answering questions, assigning them to tasks and solving any issues they may encounter while remaining calm, respectful and patient.
Trains new employees in both Dutch and English and mentors them through the first two weeks of employment.
Maintains a safe and inclusive working environment for employees of all ages, levels, cultural and personal backgrounds.
Translates official documents and minutes and interprets during meetings and job interviews (Dutch to English and English to Dutch). 
Substitutes for managers in case of absence and during that time supervises a team of 70+ employees.
profile_positions.title: Mentor

profile_positions.description:
Taught N4 and N5 Japanese grammar, kanji and vocabulary to Dutch students aged sixteen and up, accounting for differences in age, level and future goals.
Delivered two 90-minute classroom lessons weekly.
Provided online speed courses for hiragana and katakana and specialized courses for kanji.
Developed study materials for new higher-level courses and improved study materials for existing courses.
Maintained a safe and inclusive environment for every student regardless of their age, level, cultural or personal background.
Participated in promotional events, business meetings and socializing events
Organized and participated in yearly Japanese language and culture camps.
Prepared the classroom and study materials for every lesson
Oversaw classroom rules and guidelines were followed meticulously by all students and encouraged students to build new friendships through working together.
Administered exams to evaluate students’ progress and provided additional guidance to students struggling with the curriculum, setting up a plan of action to improve results.
profile_positions.title: Japanese Teacher

profile_positions.description:
Researched cultural differences and language barriers in multicultural teams by means of interviews, questionnaires and personal conversations with team members and managers.
Devised and implemented solutions to the challenges of cultural differences and language barriers in multicultural teams.
Managed communication between HERE Technologies and Japanese customers and partners while respecting cultural differences in a business setting and applying the usage of Japanese honorific speech (keigo or 敬語).
Developed an email protocol to improve the communication between teams at HERE locations in different parts of the world and responsible for the correct implementation of said protocol.
Delivered lectures and presentations on cultural differences and language barriers, with a focus on Dutch, Japanese, American and Indian culture and language.
Organized and systemized finished master orders using Office Excel as well as internal software.
 
Topic of the thesis: How are cultural differences and language barriers affecting the Japan Production Process at the Supply Chain Management Team of HERE Technologies?
